sub_title: Lunar Gateway Mission Services System Engineer
summary: My name is Fabio Tagliapietra; I have more than 19 years of experience working in the space business as a systems/software engineer and operations engineer. I graduated with a Master in Astronautics from the University of Padova. After internships at Carlo Gavazzi (Milano) and Delta Utec (Leiden), I worked for 2 years as a Spacecraft Operations Engineer in the German Space Operation Centre (GSOC) – working primarily with the unmanned missions run from there. I then joined Terma, firstly I have been working as an operations engineer located at the ATV-CC (Automated Transfer Vehicle Control Centre) in Toulouse. Here the emphasis of my responsibilities was with the simulation and training aspects. One of my key responsibilities was the Joint Integrated Simulations involving CNES, DLR/GSOC, NASA/Houston and RSA/Moscow. Then I moved to the ERA (European Robotic Arm) project where I have been responsible for the operations preparation, ground system development and testing and system engineering. From January 2019 I am the System Engineer for ERA. From January 2022 I am Mission Services System Engineer for the Lunar Gateway. I have 19 years of experience in spacecraft operational environments, 17 years in areas involving manned space (ATV, ISS, ERA, Gateway).

profile_positions.description:
Objectives:
Design and detailing of the ERA operations for ERA In-Orbit Validation (IOV) and to install the MLM Radiator and MLM Airlock on their location of destination on the ISS Russian Segment.
Activities:
-	Create “story boards” (video or power point presentations) with help of the Path Planner of the MPTE at ESA or DS;

-	Develop draft ERA Operations Plans (EOP) i.e. the files specifying all commands and parameters to be issued to the ERA on-board computer and man-machine interfaces (MMI) (possibly in close cooperation with personnel of RSC/E)
-	Support RSC/E in developing off-nominal strategies

-		Maintain the specifications
-		Maintain the world models
-			Implement new components
-			Update the models
-		Develop new generic tasks (based on new SW)
-		Develop EOPs for nominal and off-nominal 
-			Verify and simulate
-	Input to PIRNs
-	Operations, telecoms and roll-out meetings
-	Maintain FOM and ERA Datadict
-	Maintain MAS Spec
-	Review of operational documents (Mission Plans and off-nominals)
-	ERA Helpdesk
During the implementation of the ERA Support Centre he has been involved in the test phase, developing the various test procedures and manuals and running the tests. The work is develop both nominal and contingency ground operations procedures, development and verification of ground telemetry displays and applications. Video and voice loops are subject of the tests. He also supported the various stand-alone and integrated tests with MCC-M. Stand-alone or integrated tests are taking place depending on the nature of the change.
